page.title: 09 SHOPPING
page.content:
There are no shops in either of the villages of Wighill and Newton Kyme. Our shopping survey of 46 households, showed that most people did their shopping in Wetherby, some five miles away, rather than in Tadcaster which is only two miles. Only a few felt it was worthwhile to shop at either York or Leeds.
For odds and ends the majority of people went to Tadcaster. Most people did their shopping once a week. Half the survey thought shopping facilities were adequate even though many prefered to shop in Wetherby because there was more choice and variety . Nearly everybody would like to see a really big supermarket in Tadcaster. If you run out of an item you either borrow, do without or nip into Tadcaster if you have a car.
